page.title: 04People at Laverstock Church.
page.content: In this Anglican Church Dedicated to St Andrew, comfortably seating about one hundred and fifty worshippers, the congregation use the original pine seats. The Priest in charge is the vicar, the Reverend George Bull. He lives in the nearby vicarage with his wife and family. The Church is attached to the Diocese of Salisbury. Many local people help with the many aspects of church life. There are{lay {readers, altar servers, street {stewards, bell-ringers}and many people who help run the varied parish organisations, as well as an active choir, a Sunday School, Junior and Senior Youth Fellowship. The Church publishes a monthly news letter which goes to all homes.{Services are held {at traditional times,}Sundays at 8,10 and 11.00 am, also on regular weekday occasions to celebrate saints days.
